= Reading the Docs =
For more information about the code itself, extra examples etc, check out
the documentation [[https://ldas-jobs.ligo.caltech.edu/~rich.ormiston/NonlinearRegression/docs/build/html/|here]]

= NLR Code Repository =

The code for this repo is long and wonderful. The docs contain a lot
of useful info and things like math $f(x, y) = \frac{1}{\sqrt{2\pi\sigma^2}}e^{-(x-y)^2/2\sigma^2}$.
They also have _italicized_ things, *bold* things and `code highlighting`.

== Subtitle ==
Trust me, you want to run this code snippet:

{{{class="prettyprint language-bash"'
$ git clone git@git.ligo.org:NoiseCancellation/NonlinearRegression.git'
$ cd NonlinearRegression
$ ./install.sh
}}}
